solution_line_template: Two professionals work together {hours_per_day} * {professionals} = <<{hours_per_day}*{professionals}={total_hours_per_day}>>{total_hours_per_day} hours per day.
They work for {days} days, so in total it means {days} * {total_hours_per_day} = <<{days}*{total_hours_per_day}={total_hours}>>{total_hours} hours.
The cost of hiring these persons is {total_hours} * {hourly_rate} = $<<{total_hours}*{hourly_rate}={total_cost}>>{total_cost}.
